intro: Spermacoce subvulgata var. quadrisepala, commonly known as the four-lobed spurred nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple or white. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are often ovate or elliptic in shape. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands.
